speaker: Whispering Glen
line: Mist coils between pale trunks. Your footsteps sound like someone else’s memory. A wind moves through the leaves—too patterned to be chance.

speaker: Spirit Lira
line: Truth is a mirror. Most of you arrive already cracked.

speaker: Spirit Lira
line: Say what you came for, traveler—before the Glen decides you belong to it.

choices.text: I’m looking for a way through Fenmire.
I’m not here to make trouble.

speaker: Spirit Lira
line: Names are hooks. But… you may call me Lira. I was sworn once, and swearing is a kind of death that keeps talking.

speaker: Spirit Lira
line: Fen paths shift. Crossings demand a price. And when a price is not coin, it is usually you.

speaker: Hushwood Ranger
line: Don’t bargain with fog. If you must cross, do it at the old marks—stone posts half-sunk in the mire. Anything else and you’ll walk in circles until you forget why you started.

choices.text: I can help. Tell me who you lost.

speaker: Spirit Lira
line: If you keep your vows, the Glen will remember your shape. If you break them… it will remember that too.

speaker: Spirit Lira
line: Take this small mercy: when the tollman speaks, answer plainly. Cleverness is a candle in wet hands.

choices.text: Stay. I don’t want ghosts at my side.

speaker: Whispering Glen
line: The mist loosens. Somewhere beyond the trees, water moves like a slow heartbeat—Fenmire waiting to be entered.
